column1: South Gate is the 17th largest city in Los Angeles County
column3: with 7.4 square miles (19 km2). South Gate is located 7 miles (11 km) southeast of Downtown Los Angeles. It is part of the Gateway Cities region of southeastern Los Angeles County.

column4: cattle raising had been replaced by agriculture as the most important local industry. During the years between 1910 and 1940
column5: most of the agricultural land was replaced by homes and factories. Early developers accelerated the suburbanization of what was then called South Gate Gardens by subdividing the land into small plots and selling the empty plots to blue-collar workers. A majority of early homes were built individually as plot owners used "sweat equity rather than cash to construct their own homes" and the local economy relied heavily on urban agriculture.

column1: The R.D. Tweedy family played an important part in South Gate's history. Tweedy was born in 1812 in Illinois and came to California by ox-drawn cart in 1852. Mrs. Tweedy rode across the prairies perched on her rocking chair in the cart. The family was large
column2: and several generations have lived in this city. The family members bought some 2
column3: 000 acres (8.1 km2) of the land on which much of South Gate was built. The "downtown business district" in South Gate was named after the family and is known as the Tweedy Mile.

column1: The city was named in 1918 after the South Gate Gardens on the Cudahy Ranch. The city was incorporated five years later
column3: using the shortened form of the name. The name refers to the city's being south of Los Angeles.

column2: the city has a total area of 7.4 square miles (19 km2).  7.2 square miles (19 km2) of it is land and 0.1 square miles (0.26 km2) of it is water.  The total area is 1.59% water.

column1: The Los Angeles River runs through the eastern part of South Gate.
South Gate has a semi-arid Mediterranean climate with mild winters and hot
column2: dry summers. The average annual precipitation is 14.8 inches (380 mm) per year with most occurring between November and April. Temperatures range from a low of 40 °F (4 °C) to a high of 110 °F (43 °C). The average daily temperatures range from 54 °F (12 °C) to 73 °F (23 °C).

column1: South Gate developed during the 1920s and 1930s as an industrial city (primarily in "metal-bashing" industries) and its blue-collar community was predominantly non-Hispanic white.

column2: South Gate was one of the most fiercely segregationist cities in Southern California.  Gangs of white youths were known to prowl the streets looking for blacks who dared to cross over from neighboring Watts. One of the most infamous clubs of the area at that time was the "Spook Hunters".
South Gate has had a large Hispanic community
column3: which became dominant in the 1990s as working-class Hispanics and immigrant Latin American families filled the vacuum left by non-Hispanic whites
column4: leaving for more space in the outer suburbs.

column5: and was the primary supplier of aircraft engines for the B-24 Liberator
column8: as the Douglas and Consolidated companies has aircraft manufacturing facilities in Long Beach and San Diego. During the 1950s

column1: The City Council consists of five persons elected at large by the residents of South Gate. These Council members serve a four-year term and establish the governing policies and procedures for the city. The Mayor is selected on an annual
column2: rotating basis from among the Council Members.

column2: the City Clerk is responsible for maintaining all central and legal files
column3: preparing City Council meeting agendas and minutes
column4: conducting municipal elections and assisting the Los Angeles Registrar-Recorder with voter registration.
